## Re-exports[§](https://docs.rs/resvg/latest/resvg/#reexports)

`pub use tiny_skia[](https://docs.rs/tiny-skia/0.11.4/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/tiny_skia/index.html "mod tiny_skia");`

## Functions[§](https://docs.rs/resvg/latest/resvg/#functions)

[render](https://docs.rs/resvg/latest/resvg/fn.render.html "fn resvg::render")
    Renders a tree onto the pixmap.

[render_node](https://docs.rs/resvg/latest/resvg/fn.render_node.html "fn resvg::render_node")
    Renders a node onto the pixmap.

readme_summary: The `resvg` crate is a high-performance SVG rendering library designed to render SVG content onto pixel-based surfaces. It provides functions like `render` for rendering an entire SVG tree and `render_node` for rendering individual nodes. The crate re-exports `tiny-skia` for low-level graphics operations and `usvg` for parsing and manipulating SVG data.
factual_counterfactual:
### Pair 1: Rendering Capabilities  
✅ Factual: The `resvg` crate provides the `render` function, which allows rendering an entire SVG tree onto a pixmap.  
❌ Counterfactual: The `resvg` crate supports rendering SVG trees directly to PDF files without additional dependencies.  

---

### Pair 2: Dependency Integration  
✅ Factual: The `resvg` crate re-exports the `tiny_skia` and `usvg` crates, which are used internally for rendering and SVG parsing, respectively.  
❌ Counterfactual: The `resvg` crate includes built-in support for the `serde` crate to directly serialize and deserialize SVG data.  

---

### Pair 3: Node-Level Rendering  
✅ Factual: The `render_node` function in `resvg` allows rendering individual SVG nodes onto a pixmap, enabling fine-grained control over rendering.  
❌ Counterfactual: The `render_node` function in `resvg` automatically applies animations to SVG nodes during rendering.
